I filmed this and if I'm honest that bit was funniest as the guys in Foxtons were just out of shot and they were just staring through the glass at us without a clue what was going on and by the time the management realised we were filming their logo we'd got the shot and were off. :)

WRITING.TITLE: If you hate people standing on the wrong side of the escalator, you might appreciate this video - Right Side Baby!

WRITING.TEXT: Well you learn something new everyday. :) I knew Cunt was a big 'no no' in the US. Which is funny because being from Essex cunt is pretty much a term of endearment. It only feels like an insult if you emphasise the 't' at the end, then it has an element of venom about it.
Yeah, never quite understood why Americans pronounce it 'twot' but apparently it's a serious insult over there. Twat's a pretty low level insult in the UK, my Mum used it on a regular basis.

Ah that is KILLING me, both watching and playing. I can't get over how much the scrum has changed in the last 5 years. It's no fun anymore!

To me, this just shows the massive difference it makes when you have a ref who will play the advantage and not just blow up the second mistakes are made. Nothing worse than when a ref blows up for the knock on and kills the action with a scrum.
That was awesome to watch but no wonder he didn't celebrate when he scored, they must've all been knackered!
Oh my GLOB! I want that sword.
How did I not know that?! I can't imagine anyone else being Hans

WRITING.TITLE: My favourite character from any TV show. I give you Super Hans from Peep Show

WRITING.TEXT: [Original](http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded v=i6zaVYWLTkU)
WTF!? He doesn't want to be a lovable detective with OCD, he just doesn't want AIDS...oh wait... sorry nevermind

Dude I can completely relate to this, it's become a bit of joke amongst my friends how I always go for crazy chicks, some have suffered from depression, anxiety, insecurity and some have just been plain nuts. I'd been to couples therapy, counselling, hypnotherapy (which I don't believe in) as well as witnessing some pretty heavy incidents including self harm all by the time I'd reached 25. I used to joke it off that crazy girls are just the best in bed (which there is definitely a correlation) but the truth is after some introspection, the sanity of the girls I've dated ran parallel with the mental state of a member of my family. As my family member fell further into depression the crazier the girls I dated got.
I realised I couldn't fix my family member in the way I wanted so I figured if I helped these girls and fix them. Which only dragged me into their drama and made things even worse for me. It was an eye opener when I realised what I was doing. I still like to help others if they have issues but I now know not to burden myself with their problems before dealing with my own demons. However a crazy girl still gets my blood pumping...

Haha, cheers dude. I resorted to comedy because I was a **really** late bloomer puberty wise and my brother was *'the best looking guy in school'* and cast a pretty big shadow. So all through my teens I had to be funny for girls to talk to me. It's a really nice comment and not sure how I take it graciously so I'll just say I'm pleased you found it funny.
It's possible, I travel. Done neither the Frog and Bucket or The Manchester store but Edinburgh twice and a few random gigs up north. If you have seen me in real life then awesome :)

If I did find out they were doing that it would be horribly crushing, especially as I've done the joke in front of Andi but these things can happen. Also I have uploaded a video of me doing that joke on [Reddit before](http://www.reddit.com/r/StandUpComedy/comments/lkbty/i_beat_a_night_which_encourages_the_audience_to/) but not professionally filmed. Could be from that?
They put it out on a highlights reel on YouTube but don't think they broadcast on the radio. I can guarantee it's my joke, I've opened with it for almost 2 years now. (If anything need a new opener)
Thanks dude

Ah cheers mate, I did a gig in Sydney (the same trip I saw the sign) at the Laugh Garage and the crowd were amazing, I spent most the set taking the piss out of some annoying drunk Brits in the corner, they liked that. haha
[And that is all I ask](http://imgur.com/YAoNyFo)
This deserves more
